work.post_content:
The Mission

My task in this project was the technical development of the blog of Tobias van Schneider. It should serve as a user-friendly and easy-to-use resource for creative people who want to read about topics like design, productivity or career advice. I created fine UI animations and transitions that do not slow down the user‘s flow but make site more lively and unique. Additionally I improved loading times and page speed.

The Client

Tobias van Schneider is a german award-winning designer and maker living in Brooklyn, New York. He was working with Spotify as a Lead Product Designer & Art Director. Companies like Google, Red Bull, Sony or Ralph Lauren are some of his references.

The Mission

The challenge in this project was to redefine and sharpen the visual identity / branding and website of the magic entertainer Christoph Kulmer with a strong focus on high-end quality. An essential part was to give the users a magic experience on the multilingual website. The photography should transform a fancy and fashionable image to position the client in the premium market sector and was done by the awesome Harald Eisenberger.

The Client

Christoph Kulmer is an Austrian magic entertainer who specializes in close-up/stand-up magic, pickpocketing and magical product launches. His clients include companies like Red Bull, Hilton Hotels, Heineken, Lamborghini or BMW and locations like the 48 Lounge in NYC.

The Mission

The goal in this project was to create a new corporate website for the international photographer Harald Eisenberger which represents the elegant and professional style of the client. During this process I also created a new visual identity, significantly inspired by the elegance and simplicity of Scandinavian design. I am responsible for conception, design, project management and some development work in this project. Technical development by Mario Sommer and intro video production by David Köhlmeier.

The Client

Harald Eisenberger is an international photographer specialised in people, food, hotel, home and commercial objects photography. He together with his team works on full-scale photo productions. His work spans from special commissions for global clients like IKEA, Siemens, Coca Cola or Red Bull Media House to international magazines and books.

The Mission

The target of my master's thesis The device orientation playground was to research on applications of device orientation on mobile websites. During this project, a series of examples and tutorials was created with the clear intention to show possibilities of device orientation in mobile web design and development.

Scholarship

I created these examples during my exchange semester at NYU Tandon School of Engineering in the spring term of 2016. I am very thankful for the Marshall Plan Scholarship I got from the Austrian Marshall Plan Foundation.

/for/experiments.title: Experiments
/for/experiments.content:
The Mission

The target of my master's thesis The device orientation playground was to research on applications of device orientation on mobile websites. During this project, a series of examples and tutorials was created with the clear intention to show possibilities of device orientation in mobile web design and development.

Scholarship

I created these examples during my exchange semester at NYU Tandon School of Engineering in the spring term of 2016. I am very thankful for the Marshall Plan Scholarship I got from the Austrian Marshall Plan Foundation.

page_content.l_text:
360 Panorama

Take 360 images with your phone and create mobile VR experiences with very little effort. Create content with the 360 panorama app and publish it with Aframe.io on your website. See the CodePen below or take a look at my tutorial.

Colorpickr Web App

This experimental web app lets you pick HSL-colors with your mobile device based on device orientation. Rotate your phone to change the color hue and slightly tilt it to adjust saturation and lightness. It was made using Angular.js combined with Google’s Material Design.

Responsive Parallax Effect

I added responsive breakpoints to Matthew Wagerfield’s plugin parallax.js because sometimes you want to move around elements on your mobile websites on larger devices like tablets but keep em static on smaller screens like smartphones. Check out the CodePen and my tutorial.

/for/harald-eisenberger.title: Harald Eisenberger
/for/harald-eisenberger.content:
The Mission

The goal in this project was to create a new corporate website for the international photographer Harald Eisenberger which represents the elegant and professional style of the client. During this process I also created a new visual identity, significantly inspired by the elegance and simplicity of Scandinavian design. I am responsible for conception, design, project management and some development work in this project. Technical development by Mario Sommer and intro video production by David Köhlmeier.

The Client

Harald Eisenberger is an international photographer specialised in people, food, hotel, home and commercial objects photography. He together with his team works on full-scale photo productions. His work spans from special commissions for global clients like IKEA, Siemens, Coca Cola or Red Bull Media House to international magazines and books.

page_content.l_text:
Intro Animation

The experience starts with a SVG drawing animation of the logo in front of a atmospherical time-lapse video in the color scheme of the newly designed identity.

Charming Details

When hovering over the icons on the front page, each one shows some interaction in the form of a little animation.

Mobile Interactions

We made sure that the site performs and interacts seamlessly on mobile devices. The image gallery allows swipe gestures and all icon animations run smoothly.

Full Screen Menu

The various photo categories are shown in a screen-filling submenu so that the user can get a glimpse of the contents of the category.

Photo Lightbox

When clicking on a single image, it seamlessly transforms to a screen-filling lightbox with custom cursor icons to switch to the next or previous image in the gallery.

Services scroll animations

Instead of a boring list of bullet points, you can discover the services in the form of animated icons while scrolling down the page.

Contact page

Cause the weather is an important component for photographers, the contact page shows the current weather and temperature for each of the photographer’s offices. A Google map with the location show up from behind the content when needed.

/for/christoph-kulmer.title: Christoph Kulmer
/for/christoph-kulmer.content:
The Mission

The challenge in this project was to redefine and sharpen the visual identity / branding and website of the magic entertainer Christoph Kulmer with a strong focus on high-end quality. An essential part was to give the users a magic experience on the multilingual website. The photography should transform a fancy and fashionable image to position the client in the premium market sector and was done by the awesome Harald Eisenberger.

The Client

Christoph Kulmer is an Austrian magic entertainer who specializes in close-up/stand-up magic, pickpocketing and magical product launches. His clients include companies like Red Bull, Hilton Hotels, Heineken, Lamborghini or BMW and locations like the 48 Lounge in NYC.

page_content.l_text:
Intro Animation

The magic experience starts with a randomly-calculated SVG logo animation before the main content fades in sequentially.

Magic Effects

Many parts of the page slightly move around the screen controlled by (mobile) device orientation. On desktops this effect gets triggered by mouse movement.

Icon Animations

Three animated SVG icons represent the elements of the magician’s show program. On mouse-over the icons change their state through SVG morphing.

Responsive Design

All contents are styled to reach good readability across all kinds of mobile devices. Little details like animated icons make the site more lively.

Touch gestures

Just swipe through image galleries to get an impression of the magician’s events.

Business Cards

The use of heavy paper, letter-press applications and reflecting hot foil coating on the edge of the business cards show that high quality matters – no matter what part of the whole project.

/for/desk-of-van-schneider.title: DESK of van Schneider
/for/desk-of-van-schneider.content:
The Mission

My task in this project was the technical development of the blog of Tobias van Schneider. It should serve as a user-friendly and easy-to-use resource for creative people who want to read about topics like design, productivity or career advice. I created fine UI animations and transitions that do not slow down the user‘s flow but make site more lively and unique. Additionally I improved loading times and page speed.

The Client

Tobias van Schneider is a german award-winning designer and maker living in Brooklyn, New York. He was working with Spotify as a Lead Product Designer & Art Director. Companies like Google, Red Bull, Sony or Ralph Lauren are some of his references.

page_content.l_text:
Desk animation

The wordmark DESK masks a wavy HTML5 canvas animation which increases its level due to to scrolling position. Smooth hover states set a visual focus but do not slow down the user.

Responsiveness

We strongly focussed on a nice user experience on mobile phones, so our users can have an inspirational read during their morning commute.

Desktop search

Introduced with a wavy intro animation, just type in what you‘re looking for and the search does the rest for you. Search results are quickly updated whenever you hit a key, cause we have no time to loose.

Mobile search

Just type in what you‘re looking for and the search does the rest for you. Search results are quickly updated whenever you hit a key, cause we have no time to loose.

All about details

When hovering over buttons and some other controls, the background color fills the button with a wavy animation. Another small but fine detail.

Lightbox

Article images are supported by a fast and intuitive lightbox.

Mobile Lightbox

You can swipe through images opened in the lightbox mobile devices.
